title: Calories in a 10 oz Ribeye
meta_description: Discover calories in a 10 oz ribeye, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Boneless ribeye steak, cooked (grilled), USDA choice grade, separable lean and fat, trimmed to 0" fat.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, grade, cooking method, trimming, and portion accuracy. Check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A 10 oz grilled ribeye steak provides ~808 kcal and ~68 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a 10 oz ribeye steak?
faqs.a: Approximately 808 kcal for a grilled, choice-grade ribeye.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 10 oz ribeye?
faqs.a: About 68 g of protein, making it a high-protein option.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in ribeye?
faqs.a: Yes—grilling is lower; frying or adding oil/butter increases by 40–100+ kcal.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a 10 oz ribeye?
faqs.a: ~60 g total fat, including 26 g saturated, due to marbling.

faqs.q: Are these values for raw or cooked ribeye?
faqs.a: Cooked (grilled). Raw is lower in calories per weight due to water loss during cooking.
